item.title: COVID-19 Economic Effects
item.author: ben2koos@gmail.com (Ben Koos)
item.description: Given that I’m stuck inside becasue of COVID-19, I figured it would be a great time to start the website I had alwasy been thinking about starting. And what better post to start off with then about COVID-19. Given the far ranging economic consequences of forcing many millions of United States citizens to stay at home, the true economic effect of coronovirus may be inclculable. As someone who works in economic consulting, it’s interesting to me to think that even decades from now, economists will need to control for the effects of coronoavirus in their models.

item.title: Causal Forest Example
item.author: ben2koos@gmail.com (Ben Koos)
item.description: Load and Clean Data rm(list = ls()) require(grf) ## Loading required package: grf require(ggplot2) ## Loading required package: ggplot2 Data = read.delim("http://www.biostat.jhsph.edu/~cfrangak/biostat_causal/asthma.txt") Data = data.frame( matrix( unlist( strsplit( gsub( "^ ","",Data[,1] ) , " ")), nrow = 276, byrow = T)) colnames(Data) = c("pg" , "i.age", "i.sex", "i.educ", "i.insu", "i.drug", "i.seve", "com.t", "pcs.sd", "mcs.sd", "i.aqoc") for ( i in 1:ncol(Data)) { Data[,i] = as.numeric(Data[,i]) } Estimate Causal Forest X = Data[,2:10] Treat = Data$pg - 1 Outome = Data$i.

item.title: About
item.author: ben2koos@gmail.com (Ben Koos)
item.description: About Hello! this is brand new personal website where I will log analysis I have done. Since this site is brand new, I am not entirely sure what I will post about the most, but in general I am interested in economics, machine learning, statistics and cool data visualization.
